li.a: Our Commitments to Teaching and Learning

span.a: Denmark Before and After School Program

td.h3: A Note from our District Administrator

td.p: As many of you know, yesterday, Governor Evers modified his previous order of closing schools until April 6th to now read "such institutions shall remain closed for the duration of this public health emergency or until a subsequent order lifts this restriction." Essentially, this means that until further notice, we will continue to monitor things and keep you informed in a timely basis.

As a district, we will be supporting every student and family anyway we can. Teachers and support staff are diligently working to get learning materials, devices and information prepared for pick up this afternoon. Teachers will continue to support student learning through Project Based Learning, Virtual Learning, Reading, Writing, Math and everything in between.

Parents and Guardians, I want you to know that we understand that on any given day priorities and situations will change. Please do not feel overwhelmed with the educational opportunities that we are providing for your children. Do what you can with your children and utilize our teachers as resources. This is new and different for all of us. One day at a time, we will get through it.
Everyone’s safety and well-being is and will continue to be our number one priority. We will continue to update the FAQ for Parents document.

Tomorrow all schools will be open from noon until 5 p.m. We ask that only one individual come into the school to get electronic devices, learning materials and personal items from the student lockers. Please use social distancing of 6’ and sanitize hands with the provided hand sanitizer in the school entrance.

Starting Wednesday from 11 until noon, bagged lunch and breakfast will be available for curbside pickup at the high school. Starting Monday, we will also be delivering these bagged meals to our town halls for pickup. The bagged lunch and breakfast is available for all children under the ages of 18. If you have not already, please complete the food service survey.
During this time of unprecedented unknowns and a rapidly changing environment, the Denmark School District’s goal is to provide our students with every possible support.

Our staff will be planning and preparing educational enrichment materials for all of our students to utilize throughout the school closure. All of our buildings will be open from noon until 5:00 p.m. on Wednesday, March 18. During this time, students will be able to get materials, electronic devices and personal items from their lockers. We ask that only one student or one guardian go to the student lockers to get their things. Teachers will not be available during this time. Please review the link to FAQs for Parents.

We are able to continue to provide food service support to our students at no cost. Please complete the following questionnaire by Wednesday, March 18th at 10:00 a.m. if you would like to have bagged breakfast and lunch available during the school closure for pickup beginning on March 23. Food Service will review requests and provide service accordingly. Any questions please email behringj@denmark.k12.wi.us.
Food Service Survey:

p.a: Denmark School District Bagged Lunch/Breakfast survey

td.p: All co-curricular activities remain suspended until further notice.
In alignment with Governor Evers’ Executive Order, The Denmark School District will be closing schools effective immediately until April 6.

On Monday, our administrative team will be meeting to continue planning for the upcoming weeks. Our main priority is to support our students, families and staff the best we can during this closer. At this time, there will be no athletics, school activities or programs. The safety of our students, families, staff and community is our number one priority.
Again, this pandemic is changing rapidly. I will be providing another update on Monday.
The Denmark School District will be closed to all students and community members next week Monday and Tuesday.

Due to CDC and Department of Health recommendations, we are asking anyone that has recently traveled to the states of California, Washington, or New York or traveled on a cruise ship to self-quarantine for 14 days.

On Monday, our pandemic team will continue to communicate with health officials and Brown County school districts to plan and determine the next best course of action for our students, staff, families, and community. On Tuesday, we will be bringing in our teachers to update, educate and prepare to follow next steps.
Again, this pandemic is changing rapidly and I ask you to prepare for our students to be out of school for a possible prolonged period. I will be providing another update on Monday.

Governor Evers declared a State of Emergency affording the state access to additional resources to address the Coronavirus. In addition, the Wisconsin Department of Health provided guidance that includes social distancing in an effort to prevent the spread of the Coronavirus, which includes not holding events. Effective immediately for the Denmark School District, school athletics, concerts and other large group activities will be canceled and/or postponed until further notice.
At this time, the Department of Health and Human Services is not recommending closing schools.

All Brown County and local school districts have been in continuous communication pertaining to student safety and proactive measures pertaining to the Coronavirus. I will be sending out more information tomorrow pertaining to CDC and Wisconsin Department of Health recommendations.
I want everyone to know that the information and guidance we are receiving is and will continue to rapidly change.
